text: <@U0Y14MWA2>:   Agreed on Kafka and it would not be hard to output the hash chain using Kafka.   My point on etcd/raft was slightly different though.   Kafka use ZK for some pieces of coordination (although they have lots of other stuff built into the brokers as well) and unfortunately it has proven hard to completely eliminate the tie to ZK with Kafka.   My (potentially misguided) mention of Raft assumed that we built our own "broadcast" piece (i.e. our own Kafka) and that we would still need a mechanism to coordinate those processes (which is where I would the the Raft library to start with)
I don't believe Raft is the answer, but if I can take existing libraries and piece them together to prove out a basic concept, that is the approach I generally take.
<@U0Y14MWA2>: <@U0XR6J961> should wait for Honey badger  open source
HoneyBadger code is on github, just in a different branch - <https://github.com/amiller/HoneyBadgerBFT/tree/another-dev>
